required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention of Pelvic Lymphocele by Floseal During Pelvic Lymphadenectomy for Gynecologic Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Prevention of Pelvic Lymphocele by Floseal During Pelvic Lymphadenectomy for Gynecologic Cancer: a Pilot Study

oversight_info.authority: South Korea: Korea Food and Drug Administration (KFDA)

brief_summary.textblock:
Pelvic lymph node dissection (PLND) is an important step in the surgical staging and treatment of gynecologic malignancies.
Sometimes, complicated lymphoceles after PLND often delay adjuvant treatment including chemotherapy and radiation therapy, which potentially affects the success of cancer treatment.
A number of surgical techniques have developed, but failed to reduce the incidence of pelvic lymphoceles after PLND.
The investigators hypothesized that floseal can prevent lymphoceles in patients with gynecologic cancer who has undergone PLND.
The investigators designed prospective randomized controlled study as a pilot study.
The investigators will randomly apply floseal to one side of pelvis after bilateral PLND, and observe the occurence of pelvic lymphoceles after 6 months later.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.description: Frequency of ipsilateral pelvic lymphocele at post-operative 6th month.

secondary_outcome.description: lymphedema symptoms and sign at post-operative 3 and 6 month

arm_group.description: application of floseal to one side of pelvis after pelvic lymphadenectomy
counter-site of pelvis; no intervention after pelvic lymphadenectomy

intervention.description: application of floseal on intervention arm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Gynecologic cancer patients who need laparotomic bilateral PLND
Exclusion Criteria:
- Incomplete PLND which can influence the occurrence of lymphocele (surgeon's decision)
